trans-unit.source: Changing the system-wide properties by using the derby.properties file

seg-source.mrk: Changing the system-wide properties by using the derby.properties file

target.mrk: Changing the system-wide properties by using the derby.properties file

trans-unit.source: You can set persistent system-wide properties in a text file called derby.properties, which must be placed in the directory specified by the derby.system.home property.

seg-source.mrk: You can set persistent system-wide properties in a text file called derby.properties, which must be placed in the directory specified by the derby.system.home property.

target.mrk: You can set persistent system-wide properties in a text file called derby.properties, which must be placed in the directory specified by the derby.system.home property.

seg-source.mrk: derby.properties file

target.mrk: derby.properties file

seg-source.mrk: system-wide properties

target.mrk: system-wide properties

seg-source.mrk: setting

target.mrk: setting

seg-source.mrk: derby.system.home

target.mrk: derby.system.home

seg-source.mrk: determining location of derby.properties

target.mrk: determining location of derby.properties

trans-unit.source: There is one derby.properties file per system, not one per database. The file must be created in the system directory. In a client/server environment, that directory is on the server. (For more information about a system and the system directory, see .)

seg-source.mrk: There is one derby.properties file per system, not one per database.
The file must be created in the system directory.
In a client/server environment, that directory is on the server.
(For more information about a <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> system and the system directory, see <xref href="cdevdvlp27610.dita#cdevdvlp27610"></xref>.)

target.mrk: There is one derby.properties file per system, not one per database.
The file must be created in the system directory.
In a client/server environment, that directory is on the server.
(For more information about a <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> system and the system directory, see <xref href="cdevdvlp27610.dita#cdevdvlp27610"></xref>.)

seg-source.mrk: does not:

target.mrk: does not:

seg-source.mrk: Provide this file

target.mrk: Provide this file

trans-unit.source: Automatically create this file for you

seg-source.mrk: Automatically create this file for you

target.mrk: Automatically create this file for you

trans-unit.source: Automatically write any properties or values to this file

seg-source.mrk: Automatically write any properties or values to this file

target.mrk: Automatically write any properties or values to this file

trans-unit.source: Instead, you must create, write, and edit this file yourself.

seg-source.mrk: Instead, you must create, write, and edit this file yourself.

target.mrk: Instead, you must create, write, and edit this file yourself.

trans-unit.source: The file should be in the format created by the java.util.Properties.save method.

seg-source.mrk: The file should be in the format created by the java.util.Properties.save method.

target.mrk: The file should be in the format created by the java.util.Properties.save method.

trans-unit.source: The following is the text of a sample properties file:

seg-source.mrk: The following is the text of a sample properties file:

target.mrk: The following is the text of a sample properties file:

seg-source.mrk: derby.infolog.append=true derby.storage.pageSize=8192 derby.storage.pageReservedSpace=60

target.mrk: derby.infolog.append=true derby.storage.pageSize=8192 derby.storage.pageReservedSpace=60

trans-unit.source: Properties set this way are persistent for the system until changed, until the file is removed from the system, or until the system is booted in some other directory (in which case would be looking for derby.properties in that new directory). If a database is removed from a system, system-wide properties do not "travel" with the database unless explicitly set again.

seg-source.mrk: Properties set this way are persistent for the system until changed, until the file is removed from the system, or until the system is booted in some other directory (in which case would be looking for derby.properties in that new directory).
If a database is removed from a system, system-wide properties do not "travel" with the database unless explicitly set again.

target.mrk: Properties set this way are persistent for the system until changed, until the file is removed from the system, or until the system is booted in some other directory (in which case would be looking for derby.properties in that new directory).
If a database is removed from a system, system-wide properties do not "travel" with the database unless explicitly set again.
